intro: Xyris riopretensis, commonly known as the Rio Pretense Yellow-eyed Grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Xyridaceae, which includes various grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. Xyris riopretensis is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
